title: Extension to LearnR
text: teachr enables instructor explicitly set topics sections can accessed use http get requests, included template’s javascript code(teachr/inst/man/rmarkdown/templates/tutorial/resources/tutorial-format.js). http get request triggered student clicks “Next Topic” “Continue”. parameters get request follows: - topic: topic id, format section-header-2-name. example, (## Topic 1) becomes (section-topic-1). - section: section id, format section-header-3-name. example, (### Exercise 1) becomes (section-exercise-1). - type=1: preset parameter (1) intended future extensions teachr, additional get requests may supported. Please note, “Continue” button shown https://pkgs.rstudio.com/learnr/articles/exercises.html?q=progress#progressive-reveal set. Also, get requests sent checking exercise can https://pkgs.rstudio.com/learnr/articles/exercises.html?q=progress#exercise-skipping. feature designed primarily active lectures lab activities, instructor may want limit far ahead students can progress. Additionally, feature helpful hiding tutorial sections, removing need manually edit & re-deploy tutorial.

title: Extension to LearnR
text: Student submissions can recorded use post requests. requests triggered student submits exercise quiz question grading. features built learnr’s built https://pkgs.rstudio.com/learnr/articles/publishing.html#event-handlers, used capture transmit student submissions. default, graded coding exercises transmitted. transmit coding exercises, uncomment additional code provided else{} statement. parameters provided teachr follows: - student_id: Initially set student’s login (run RStudio), can manually set within tutorial. - exercise_id: name exercise/quiz’s code chunk (```{r, exercise_name}) - is_correct: submission marked - TRUE (correct), FALSE (incorrect), NA (graded) - submission: Either student’s code answer chose question
